body.p:
Dixon / Webster Co Ky Sept 24th 1865
Mr Bramlett
Sir

Our country having been over run by thieves and Robers for some time past ^By^ stealing Horses plundering and robing Houses almost every night we know the men they are scattered all through the country they have two trains we call them, one to run the Horses to illinois and the other to Run them to Tennessee they are so bad we cannot Stand them I have been requested by a Great many of our Best citizens to recruit a square for the purpose of putting down men of this character. I do not feel willing to make the attempt without some authority from the proper one and if you will Grant me the permition to recruit this squad I will faithfully discharge my duties as their commander I will arm and mount my men my self and will dispose of the prisoners as you think best
we have no soldiers here now to protect us and we are Bound to do something or go by the Board

States that that portion of the country is overrun by thieves and robbers, who are stealing houses, and robbing and plundering houses. Asks permission to raise a squad of men, who will arm and mount himself, for the purpose of bringing them to justice

Ans. Oct 3d 65. Lt Bk B. p 294.
Rec I. G. O. Oct 3d 1865
